reviews.text: Stayed in the Marietta twice now with 2 small children. We had 2 storey accomodation which did make it difficult with 2 small children as the stairs were marble and also spiral. The room was clean and well maintained. The owners were very welcoming and did everything they could to ensure our holiday was one to remember. The pool was clean and had a small pool for the children, it was a safe area for them to play. There was a small grassed area with a swing which our children used now and then. The bar served snacks and good beer, you can sit and watch the pool in the afternoon with a mythos!! The walk into Skala was along a main road but was never a problem for us - mainly because this "main" road was so quiet, typical of the area. Skala itself is lovely, just enough bars and restaurants for a good balance.
reviews.title: Marietta - Family of 4 experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Marietta for our honeymoon and the place was very clean, friendly with good bar snacks a nice clean bar, which, was quiet but we went at the end of May which was the very early part of the season, the pool area was also very clean and relaxing and just a short walk to the bar made sure you had a nice cool drink to take back to your lounger, the rooms were basic, but, you had what you needed for your stay and they were cleaned every day with fresh sheets and towels every 2 days. The bed was unfortunately like sleeping on a rock, the only thing that we can really complain about the whole stay. A 5/10min walk would get you to the beach or the town/village quite easily. For those that like dining out this place is packed with restaurants and bars, we found that after trying quite a few of the restaurants we settled on one called "Siroco", a nice warm family run place whith exellent home cooked traditional food, Andreas and Karen made you feel very welcome and relaxed. We would like to go back, but, the only reason we dont is because we want to try other places as well.
reviews.title: Great place with top settings and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Kefalonia many times, and decided last minute to have a break there half term end of october. Even though the hotel was booking guests in still, they werent offering the full services you expect, the weather was nice, but there was no ice cream avaliable. This was our major dissapointment along with the poor quailty breakfast, we wouldnt suggest doing B&B, its just pathetic the breakfast they offer, cheap cereals or toast. Round the corner is, Kalyva, a great place to eat thats really cheap and you get loads. So go there.
reviews.title: Great place, wrong time to go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some tour companies pull out of kefalonia september and some october, this is bad for the island, has half of the places shut october, even though the weather is much nicer than in the uk, its was 24c most days.
reviews.title: friendly, clean, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love skala, we love kefalonia, but only going June to September.
reviews.title: Best Place in the Sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from this hotel with my husband, daughter and her husband. Ages range from 25 - 54 and we all thought is was a great place to stay. The pool was a lovely place to relax in the daytime and the beach was not too far away. God restaurants within easy walking distance, too many to choose from, so we ate in a different restaurant every night but our favourtine was Symposium on the front and also the Pines was a very close 2nd.
reviews.title: Relaxing holiday

reviews.text: We were on the 2nd floor in the peach coloured building and everything was very well kept and very clean.I was a bit worried as some comments about this hotel said there were a lot of stairs but I didn't find the stairs difficult or there is a ramp if you don't want to use the stairs.
reviews.title: It was wonderful

reviews.text: All in all a very relaxing holiday and we would definitely return to this hotel. Would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay, would return!

reviews.text: My ten year old daugher and I just returned from Marietta in Skala. We had a fantastic time. What struck me most is the friendliness of the greek people despite being swamped by a wave of all english holiday makers. I was slighly apprehensive, but without exception we have encountered genuinely welcoming and kind people, which alone made the trip wonderful.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, pleasant staff and beautiful gardens.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marietta Appartments - I cannot fault it. We had ground floor appartment 23A, and it made a perfect little home for 12 nights, overlooking a small garden with a firework of mediteranean flowers, with lots of rare butterflies and hummingbird moths. We made our own breakfast, as the kitchen was fully equipped, including kettle. Breakfast is available in the bar, but we enjoyed our shady terrace in the morning. The bathroom was clean and functional and we had NO smells from our drain. The bed was comfortable, the pillows soft (after reading a review on the pillows being hard I decided we should take our own - it was not necessary!)
reviews.title: Excellent self catering appartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read previous reviews prior to booking we were a little concerned on what we would find on arrival, however we were pleasantly suprised.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay, would go back to this accommodation

reviews.text: The complex is very well looked after and the gardens really compliment the buildings.
reviews.title: Hotel Ok - Not really suitable for young families
Brilliant holiday will book again!!
reviews.text: Pool area is excellent, yes people did put towels out but we never struggled to get four sunbeds together. There is some shade which alternates during the day and there are large parasols above some of the sunbeds, if you want one of these you will mostly have to get to the pool with your towels about 8:45.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are notices stating no diving, no plastics etc in the pool, but most people ignored them anyway, however the behaviour of all the families using the facility was very considerate.
reviews.title: Most relaxing holiday so far!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was at the back of the complex so it was an uphill walk but we didn't find it a problem and we are all over 60. Rooms are typically greek i.e. basic and although we had a fridge (bed and breakfast) we didn't have a kettle but took our own travlel one. Although the temperature was above 30 degrees most days, we managed without the aircon, just left window slightly open and used plug in unit to keep mossies at bay.
reviews.title: enjoyed hoilday but poor hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for a week, lovely apartments in lovely skala, beautiful stunning kefalonia! Apartments are very pretty, set into the hillside, pristine areas around the pool and communal areas, lovely friendly feel to the place. Would recommend. We hired a car, drove all over the island, steep roads sheer drops off mountains and hair pin bends! Not to mention pot holes. But the most fabulous Stunning scenery to be seen.
reviews.title: Lovely apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is about a 10 minute walk from Skala town, so nice and quiet. Very friendy reception on arrival. We were shown to our room, quite a walk up the hill, not for the faint hearted. Spotless rooms, plenty of space and clean bathrooms. Balcony large with great views f the mountains ( we were based t the top of the hill). A small fridge with a small freezer section for ice cubes. No kettle, as we went b&b. Rooms not b& b so have kettles.
reviews.title: Great place, but not for those with poor mobility or unable to walk to far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We. Went b & b. breakfast ok, boiled egg, yogurt, toast tea and coffee. Great service by all staff, very friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: First customers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool very clean, need to be by the pool by 8.30 in the morning to get a sunbed with shade. Pool bar and snacks very good. The walk into town takes about 10 mins, this may be challenging if you have walking difficulties as slightly up hill. To walk to the beach it is probably a 15 - 20 minute walk from the hotel. There are several nice places by the beach, to have a drink or something to eat and watch the world go by. Our favourite is a small place, left of the square down a small hill/ steps.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A favorite to eat in the evening was Gourgouris, on the crossroads opposite the Church, a fabulous place, very good value and superb food, meza a must, the rosa wine is actually very good. Must get a table by the front, too hot if you sit in towards the resturant. You can book tel 26710 83584 to reserve the tables by the road, a quite road.
reviews.title: AMAZING HOLIDAY!!
